title: Fundamentals of Organic Chemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of organic chemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Introduction to Materials Chemistry
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in materials chemistry. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Intermediate Materials Chemistry
description: Comprehensive study of materials chemistry with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Organic Chemistry
description: Comprehensive study of organic chemistry with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Advanced Physical Chemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of physical chemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Advanced Analytical Chemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of analytical chemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Advanced Materials Chemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of materials chemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Graduate Organic Chemistry
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of organic chemistry. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: CHEM 334 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Environmental Chemistry
description: Comprehensive study of environmental chemistry with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: CHEM 330 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Biochemistry
description: Rigorous treatment of biochemistry theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: CHEM 373 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Medicinal Chemistry
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in medicinal chemistry. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: CHEM 353 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Analytical Chemistry
description: Rigorous treatment of analytical chemistry theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: CHEM 304 and senior standing or graduate status
